rent verb
(PAY TO USE)
A2 [ T ] to pay or receive a fixed amount of money for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc.: I rented a car from a garage so that I could get about. [ + two objects ] The old lady rented me her spare bedroom for £200 a week. My Dad has a villa that he rents (out) to tourists. Compare
hire
More examplesFewer examplesPersonnel will help you find a flat to rent.She rented a room above a shop.We're renting a cottage in Wales for the summer.We scoped out the local shops and facilities to see if it would be a good place to rent a flat.The landlord rents the flat out through a letting agency.
